word: We want more, much more, of the Spirit of Christ, and less, much less, of self and the peculiarities of character which build up a wall to keep us apart from our fellow beings. We can do much to break down these barriers by revealing the graces of Christ in our lives. Jesus has been trusting His goods to the church, age after age. One generation after another for century after century have been gathering up their hereditary trust until the increasing responsibilities have descended to our time. . . . We want to be clothed, not in our own garments, but in the whole armor of Christ\92s righteousness.\97Atlantic Canvasser, Dec. 18, 1890.
